actor_awards.notes: A prolific British character actor who became a fixture in American screwball comedies and musicals. He is best remembered for playing the eccentric, often impertinent, 'gentleman's gentleman' or valet, appearing in five Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers musicals. He also voiced Mr. Toad in Disney's 'The Adventures of Ichabod and Mr. Toad'.

filmography.title: Top Hat
filmography.role_description: The loyal but meddling valet to Jerry Travers who gets entangled in the mistaken identity plot.
filmography.plot: An American dancer comes to London and falls for a model who mistakes him for his goofy producer.

filmography.title: The Lady Eve
filmography.role_description: A con artist posing as a British aristocrat who helps the protagonist in her scheme.
filmography.plot: A trio of classy card sharks targets a socially awkward heir to a brewery fortune on an ocean liner.

filmography.title: The Gay Divorcee
filmography.role_description: An eccentric waiter who attempts to force interaction between the leads and delivers the memorable 'Knock Knees' line.
filmography.plot: A woman thinks a flirting man is the co-respondent her lawyer has hired to expedite her divorce.

filmography.title: Sullivan's Travels
filmography.role_description: The cynical and pragmatic valet who warns his director employer about the realities of poverty.
filmography.plot: A director of escapist comedies decides to experience life as a hobo to make a socially relevant film.

filmography.title: Swing Time
filmography.role_description: The owner of a dance school who interacts with the gambling dancer Lucky Garnett.
filmography.plot: A performer with a penchant for gambling goes to New York City to earn enough money to marry his fiancée but falls for a dance instructor.

filmography.title: Shall We Dance
filmography.role_description: The floorwalker/manager of the hotel who tries to manage the chaos surrounding the main characters.
filmography.plot: A ballet dancer and a tap dancer fake a marriage for publicity, then fall in love.

filmography.title: The Adventures of Ichabod and Mr. Toad
filmography.role_description: The voice of the adventurous, wealthy, and reckless J. Thaddeus Toad.
filmography.plot: An animated package film featuring two segments: one based on 'The Wind in the Willows' and the other on 'The Legend of Sleepy Hollow'.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Cinematography - Color

filmography.title: It's Love I'm After
filmography.role_description: The loyal and heavily put-upon valet to the egocentric actor Basil Underwood.
filmography.plot: A bickering stage couple intends to marry, but the actor decides to help a fan who has fallen for him, leading to complications.

filmography.title: The Lone Wolf Spy Hunt
filmography.role_description: The valet to the reformed jewel thief Michael Lanyard, marking his first appearance in the series.
filmography.plot: A retired jewel thief is framed for robbery and must catch the real criminals to clear his name.

filmography.title: Swiss Miss
filmography.role_description: The brother of a composer who gets entangled with Laurel and Hardy in the Swiss Alps.
filmography.plot: Laurel and Hardy travel to Switzerland to sell mousetraps but end up working at a hotel to pay off their bills.

filmography.title: Road to Zanzibar
filmography.role_description: An eccentric character encountered by Hope and Crosby on their African adventure.
filmography.plot: Two sideshow performers travel across Africa on a safari with two women who are actually con artists.

filmography.title: Holy Matrimony
filmography.role_description: A man whose identity is assumed by a famous painter wishing to escape his celebrity.
filmography.plot: A famous painter poses as his dead valet to avoid the limelight, but complications arise when the valet's fiancée shows up.

filmography.title: The Moon and Sixpence
filmography.role_description: A charming scoundrel who interacts with the Gauguin-inspired artist protagonist.
filmography.plot: A stockbroker abandons his job and family to pursue his dream of becoming an artist in Tahiti.

filmography.title: Breakfast for Two
filmography.role_description: The valet to a wealthy idler who tries to help his employer navigate romance and business.
filmography.plot: A Texas heiress tries to reform a heavy-drinking steamship line heir and save his company.

filmography.title: Fancy Pants
filmography.role_description: A British aristocrat visiting the American West in this Bob Hope comedy.
filmography.plot: An American actor posing as a British butler is hired to refine a rough-and-tumble family in the Wild West.

filmography.title: Flying Down to Rio
filmography.role_description: The assistant manager of the hotel in Rio, constantly flustered by the musicians.
filmography.plot: A band leader and a beautiful woman fall in love in Rio de Janeiro, featuring the first screen pairing of Astaire and Rogers.

filmography.title: The Sky's the Limit
filmography.role_description: The employer of Fred Astaire's character in this wartime musical.
filmography.plot: A Flying Tiger pilot on leave in New York City falls for a photographer but keeps his identity a secret.

filmography.title: The Shanghai Gesture
filmography.role_description: A cynical bookkeeper at a Shanghai gambling den.
filmography.plot: The owner of a gambling casino in Shanghai deals with her past and her daughter's addiction.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Art Direction, Best Music

filmography.title: Forever and a Day
filmography.role_description: A butler in the modern segment of this multi-generational anthology film.
filmography.plot: The story of a London house and its inhabitants from 1804 to the London Blitz of World War II.

filmography.title: San Diego I Love You
filmography.role_description: The fussy brother of a wealthy businessman who gets involved with an eccentric family.
filmography.plot: A family travels to San Diego to sell the father's invention, getting involved in various misadventures.

filmography.title: Quality Street
filmography.role_description: A comedic recruiting sergeant in this adaptation of J.M. Barrie's play.
filmography.plot: A woman disguises herself as her own niece to win back the affections of the man she loves.

filmography.title: Joy of Living
filmography.role_description: A family member who mooches off the famous singer protagonist.
filmography.plot: A Broadway star supports her selfish family until a wealthy ship owner teaches her to enjoy life.

filmography.title: Love on a Bet
filmography.role_description: A friend of the protagonist who accompanies him on a cross-country journey.
filmography.plot: A man bets his rich uncle that he can travel from New York to Los Angeles starting with only his underwear.

filmography.title: Diamond Jim
filmography.role_description: A character in the biopic of the flamboyant businessman Diamond Jim Brady.
filmography.plot: The life and times of turn-of-the-century tycoon Diamond Jim Brady.

filmography.title: A Woman of Distinction
filmography.role_description: The fussy public relations man for a college dean.
filmography.plot: A dignified college dean and a British astronomy professor get caught up in a scandal.
